Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Shared Decision-Making in Major Surgery for Older Adults

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive a question prompt list brochure or standard care.

Participants.evidence: included 43 surgeons and 446 patients aged 60 or older with at least one comorbidity, conducted at outpatient surgical clinics across five academic centers.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive a question prompt list brochure or standard care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the OPTION5 score, measuring shared decision-making (range 0-100), assessed over consultations from June 1, 2016, to November 31, 2018.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive a question prompt list brochure or standard care.
